bug.short_desc: Support Version Macro in JSDoc Comments

long_desc.thetext:
In order to make references, e.g. to manual pages or Demobrowser demos, the corresponding links need to contain a version string. To avoid maintainence overhead, these version strings should not be literal (unless they are meant to be fixed), but as a macro that references the current version so that all occurrences are updated when the macro definition is changed.
As API doc is generated, it will not impact the normal work flow of producing the Apiviewer with its data. Replacement of the macro reference should be done through the generator (rather than the Apiviewer at run time). ecmalint/frontend/comment.py should probably support this (e.g. via cleanupText()). It has to be sorted out where the macro definitions are kept.
I just added two links in the qx.Theme class referencing http://manual.qooxdoo.org/1.4/......
